mdRecord.dcterms:title: Survey of lands in Frederick County left to John Augustine Washington by Lawrence Washington, 1767 December 1
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: George Washington prepared this survey for his younger brother John Augustine Washington of lands left to him by their older brother Lawrence Washington, who died in 1752. The four parcels of land surveyed, totaling 1,543 acres, are located in present-day Jefferson County, West Virginia. Autograph document signed, 2 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: West Virginia
